text: what's up outliers quick market update for us we have three things on the agenda I'm going to take a look at the fomc meeting coming up tomorrow what the probabilities are looking like and kind of what we might expect then I'm going to talk a little bit about chewy because somebody asked me to take a look at the options chain there and then we'll take a cursory overview of GameStop and see if anything interesting is peeking up in there so let's get started what's going on with the broad Market well it seems like we are still expecting this rate cut I can see that across all the different indices the SP 500 just hit new all-time highs The Q's technology more heavy kind of lagging behind a bit here and then small caps are actually starting to catch up to near-term highs so right now it looks like the market is still favoring small caps at this point over technology but the SP 500 RIT large is the leader of the the pack so what that tells me is that the overall growth that we're seeing just in terms of the indices themselves is not actually being driven by Tech and it's worth noting because for such a long period of time that's been the primary driver of value inside the SP 500 which has been Tech now as we're looking at it we can see xlb so things that are starting to look at

text: expirations I see a ton of calls traded today against puts 89,000 calls versus 13,700 puts and I see most of them coming in at the offer above so we're buying those so yeah overall the options chain in GameStop is still again on a relative basis quiet but it's definitely not silent to any degree so if we take a look at kind of this week so far and we get rid of the bids and we'll get rid of the puts we're now seeing just some further term expirations we already talked about these so this is nothing novel but this is still relatively new for GameStop where we're seeing these longer term positions being built out now in the near term it still looks a little bit quiet as far as I can tell but as always if there's anything that's jumping out at you or that you want take a look at let me know for the gme live stream this coming Saturday we're going to go into part three of analyzing brory kitties old trades which Newton and I talked a lot about that because he has a lot of ideas about some of the behaviors and I want to see if we can pick up any of those based on what we've been seeing so far because I definitely am getting a really good feel for the way that Ryan Kitty was thinking about his options trades building them and then managing them so
